DataElement.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcome Problem Menses Pain Past Week Severity Score_11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how bad, if at all, menstrual pain/cramping have been a problem during the past week, including today, using an 11-point Likert scale where 0 is not a problem and 10 is as bad as possible.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcome Problem Menses Pain Past Week Severity Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptons, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._Periodic discharge of blood and tissue from the uterus.  Until menopause, menstruation occurs approximately every 28 days when a woman is not pregnant.:The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.:The most recent week, including today.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptons, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

Concepts.definition: Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptoms, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

Property.preferredName: Menses Pain Past Week Severity Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Periodic discharge of blood and tissue from the uterus.  Until menopause, menstruation occurs approximately every 28 days when a woman is not pregnant.:The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.:The most recent week, including today.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The normal physiologic discharge through the vagina of blood and mucosal tissues from the nonpregnant uterus.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Past Week Severity Score Integer::11 Point Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:A number with no fractional part.::11:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Touch the red dot below that best describes how bad, if at all, menstrual pain/cramping have been a problem for you during the past week, including today.
